item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 29, 2025 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Ötzi, the 4000-year-old iceman mummy, had Lyme disease (20 points | 1 comment)
2. DeepSeek proves the future of LLMs is open-source (416 points | 170 comments)
3. An Analysis of DeepSeek's R1-Zero and R1 (32 points | 7 comments)
4. Society for Technical Communication to permanently close its doors (28 points | 2 comments)
5. I still like Sublime Text (770 points | 423 comments)
6. Bacteria (and Their Metabolites) and Depression (315 points | 127 comments)
7. Case Study: ByteDance Uses eBPF to Enhance Networking Performance (19 points | discuss)
8. A story about restoring and upgrading a Commodore Amiga 1000 (77 points | 15 comments)
9. Frigade (YC W23) is hiring engineer #2 ( | hide)
10. Intel doesn't know how to be a foundry," Tim Cook reportedly told TSMC's CEO (16 points | 4 comments)
11. Seagate: 'new' hard drives used for tens of thousands of hours (222 points | 126 comments)
12. New speculative attacks on Apple CPUs (1008 points | 326 comments)
13. Complete hardware and software setup for running Deepseek-R1 locally. ($6000) (155 points | 107 comments)
14. Google Pixel 4a old firmware is gone, trapping users on the buggy battery update (122 points | 87 comments)
15. Preserves: An Expressive Data Language (55 points | 21 comments)
16. No Man's Sky's update introduces billions of new stars, planets, and more (12 points | 1 comment)
17. The ancient discovery that put a Silk Road city back on the map (28 points | 7 comments)
18. OpenAI says it has evidence DeepSeek used its model to train competitor (35 points | 590 comments)
19. Cali's AG Tells AI Companies Almost Everything They're Doing Might Be Illegal (135 points | 96 comments)
20. How to run DeepSeek R1 locally (64 points | 19 comments)
21. Adding concurrent read/write to DuckDB with Arrow Flight (52 points | 13 comments)
22. Effective AI code suggestions: less is more (5 points | 3 comments)
23. Boom XB-1 First Supersonic Flight [video] (664 points | 476 comments)
24. Proof of concept WMI virus (zero-day) (54 points | 14 comments)
25. Astral – "We're building a new static type checker for Python" (15 points | 1 comment)
26. Only 1 in 10 Oracle Java users want to stay with Big Red (32 points | 16 comments)
27. Composable SQL (240 points | 114 comments)
28. Science YouTuber physicsgirl (Dianna Cowern) stands for the first time in 2 yrs (623 points | 239 comments)
29. IAC confirms existence of a Super-earth in the habitable zone of a Sun-like Star (403 points | 263 comments)
30. I do not want AI to "polish" me (354 points | 228 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 29, 2025 at 6:20 PM UTC
